messages.title: MAN OF THE YEAR
messages.content: Tom Brake was voted '2004 Man of the Year' by readers of the Sutton Guardian.

messages.title: SUTTON LIB DEMS THE WINNING TEAM
messages.content: Tom has helped to turn Sutton into one of the best boroughs in London.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Tom proposes a fairer local income tax.
Tom Brake wants a doorstep recycling service for every household.

mentions.candidate: Tom Brake has been singled out for his work for the environment by Friends of the Earth.
mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: Has criticised the Conservative Council's decision to...

issues.economy: Tom says that Liberal Democrats are winning the argument on the economy.
issues.education: Lib Dems, nationally and locally, have prioritised education, resulting in better school buildings and teacher numbers.
issues.environment: Tom has been singled out for his work for the environment.
issues.governance: Tom has called for cleaner, more honest politics.
issues.health: Tom has opposed post office closures.

housing.content: Tom has stood up against Conservative plans for overdevelopment.

leaflet.personalStatement: Tom Brake has always been a community campaigner. Born in Melton Mowbray and brought up in France...

politicalExperience.achievements: Fought successfully for more local police and the rebuilding of St Helier Hospital.

contactInformation.address: Kennedy House, 5 Nightingale Road, Carshalton, Surrey, SM5 2DN

endorsements.endorsement: They have singled out Tom Brake for his work for the environment.

quotes.text: Tom Brake is a hard working, local MP who really stands up for local people.

images.caption: Tom Brake working at Kennedy House.
Tom Brake participating in local community events.
